forkee.name: spock
forkee.description: The Enterprise-ready testing and specification framework.

issue.title: MockitoMockMaker provides mocking of static methods
issue.body:
MockitoMockMaker supports to mock static methods
of Java classes with the new Spec API:

`MockStatic()`
`StubStatic()`
`SpyStatic()`

This also supports Java callers of the static methods.

Usage sample:

```groovy
given:
MockStatic(StaticClass)
when:
def result = StaticClass.staticMethod()
then:
1 * StaticClass.staticMethod() >> MOCK_VALUE
result == MOCK_VALUE
```

comment.body:
In regard to [mockito/#3037](https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/3037):
I would say we can wait how the Mockito team tries to tackle the issue, because if users want to use the `mockito` mock maker of spock, they need to add mockito to the runtime classpath on their own. So if mockito e.g. recommends to add it as agent, the same documentation of mockito will apply to us. Beside from that we do not need to change our integration, because we do not require mockito as a dependency.

Maybe we can add a "check/hint" in the future, when Mockito has settled on a solution, if we can provide any help here.
E.g. add a sentence to the error message of the `mockito` mock maker and documentation, the tbd. usage pattern of Mockito, if the running JRE is >= 21.

pull_request.title: Update dependency org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent to v0.8.11
pull_request.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent](http://jacoco.org) ([source](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco)) | `0.8.10` -> `0.8.11` | [![age](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/age/maven/org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent/0.8.11?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/adoption/maven/org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent/0.8.11?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/compatibility/maven/org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent/0.8.10/0.8.11?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/confidence/maven/org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent/0.8.10/0.8.11?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>jacoco/jacoco (org.jacoco:org.jacoco.agent)</summary>

### [`v0.8.11`](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/releases/tag/v0.8.11): 0.8.11

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/compare/v0.8.10...v0.8.11)

#### New Features

-   JaCoCo now officially supports Java 21 (GitHub [#​1520](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1520)).
-   Experimental support for Java 22 class files (GitHub [#​1479](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1479)).
-   Part of bytecode generated by the Java compilers for exhaustive switch expressions is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#​1472](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1472)).
-   Part of bytecode generated by the Java compilers for record patterns is filtered out during generation of report (GitHub [#​1473](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1473)).

#### Fixed bugs

-   Instrumentation should not cause `VerifyError` when the last local variable of method parameters is overridden in the method body to store a value of type long or double (GitHub [#​893](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/893)).
-   Restore exec file compatibility with versions from 0.7.5 to 0.8.8 in case of class files with zero line numbers (GitHub [#​1492](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1492)).

#### Non-functional Changes

-   jacoco-maven-plugin now requires at least Java 8 (GitHub [#​1466](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1466), [#​1468](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1468)).
-   JaCoCo build now requires at least Maven 3.5.4 (GitHub [#​1467](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1467)).
-   Maven 3.9.2 should not produce warnings for jacoco-maven-plugin (GitHub [#​1468](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1468)).
-   JaCoCo build now requires JDK 17 (GitHub [#​1482](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1482)).
-   JaCoCo now depends on ASM 9.6 (GitHub [#​1518](https://togithub.com/jacoco/jacoco/issues/1518)).

</details>

---

### Configuration

📅 **Schedule**: Branch creation - At any time (no schedule defined), Automerge - At any time (no schedule defined).

🚦 **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Please merge this manually once you are satisfied.

♻ **Rebasing**: Whenever PR becomes conflicted, or you tick the rebase/retry checkbox.

🔕 **Ignore**: Close this PR and you won't be reminded about this update again.

commits.message:
Validate argument amount in old(...) calls (#1810)

Previously if you had multiple arguments to an `old(...)` call 2nd and
on were simply ignored,
and if you had no argument the compiler throws a `NullPointerException`.

Now the compiler validates that there is exactly one argument to an `old(...)` call.

Due to the multiple arguments now being forbidden, this is theoretically
a breaking change,
but until recently the whole feature was not even documented and
probably very few people use it at all, let alone with multiple arguments.

issue.title: Validate argument amount in old(...) calls
issue.body:
Previously if you had multiple arguments to an `old(...)` call 2nd and on were simply ignored,
and if you had no argument the compiler throws a `NullPointerException`.

Now the compiler validates that there is exactly one argument to an `old(...)` call.

Due to the multiple arguments now being forbidden, this is theoretically a breaking change,
but until recently the whole feature was not even documented and probably very few people
use it at all, let alone with multiple arguments.

comment.body: I agree, the alternative would be to `synchronize` on the closure, but I think the `clone` is the better choice. Even groovy does it, couldn't we just use `org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.DefaultGroovyMethods#with(U, groovy.lang.Closure<T>)` ?

pull_request.title: Some improvements for the work from PR #1753
pull_request.body:
I had a half-finished review of PR #1753, then got a bad cold.
Now you merged it already, so I moved my review comments into this PR here.

Most changes are just minor.

One notable change is, that I changed the order of cglib and mockito.
Even though cglib is deprecated, I think it should sill be selected before mockito for consistency.
If you currently have cglib on the classpath but no byte buddy, it will be used,
then with the new version suddenly mockito will be used which could change the behavior.
It swapped the order, so that mockito is below, so that it is just used as fallback for cases that couldn't be handled before.
What do you think?

Another notable change is, that I changed the toString of the mock maker settings implementations that just returned the
mock maker id before and now return "mockito mock maker settings" or "<ID> simple mock maker settings".
What do you think?

repo.name: spock
repo.description: The Enterprise-ready testing and specification framework.

Now you merged it already, so I moved my review comments into this PR here.

Most changes are just minor.

One notable change is, that I changed the order of cglib and mockito.
Even though cglib is deprecated, I think it should sill be selected before mockito for consistency.
If you currently have cglib on the classpath but no byte buddy, it will be used,
then with the new version suddenly mockito will be used which could change the behavior.
It swapped the order, so that mockito is below, so that it is just used as fallback for cases that couldn't be handled before.

Another notable change is, that I changed the toString of the mock maker settings implementations that just returned the
mock maker id before and now return "mockito mock maker settings" or "<ID> simple mock maker settings".
What do you think?

pull_request.title: Some improvements for the work from PR #1753
pull_request.body:
I had a half-finished review of PR #1753, then got a bad cold.
Now you merged it already, so I moved my review comments into this PR here.

Most changes are just minor.

One notable change is, that I changed the order of cglib and mockito.
Even though cglib is deprecated, I think it should sill be selected before mockito for consistency.
If you currently have cglib on the classpath but no byte buddy, it will be used,
then with the new version suddenly mockito will be used which could change the behavior.
It swapped the order, so that mockito is below, so that it is just used as fallback for cases that couldn't be handled before.
What do you think?

Another notable change is, that I changed the toString of the mock maker settings implementations that just returned the
mock maker id before and now return "mockito mock maker settings" or "<ID> simple mock maker settings".
What do you think?

comment.body:
I think we need to `clone` the closure here as the old code did. 
Because otherwise the `setDelegate()` can be a race, if you share MockitoMockMakerSettings between multiple concurrent test executions.

pull_request.title: Some improvements for the work from PR #1753
pull_request.body:
I had a half-finished review of PR #1753, then got a bad cold.
Now you merged it already, so I moved my review comments into this PR here.

Most changes are just minor.

One notable change is, that I changed the order of cglib and mockito.
Even though cglib is deprecated, I think it should sill be selected before mockito for consistency.
If you currently have cglib on the classpath but no byte buddy, it will be used,
then with the new version suddenly mockito will be used which could change the behavior.
It swapped the order, so that mockito is below, so that it is just used as fallback for cases that couldn't be handled before.
What do you think?

Another notable change is, that I changed the toString of the mock maker settings implementations that just returned the
mock maker id before and now return "mockito mock maker settings" or "<ID> simple mock maker settings".
What do you think?

issue.title: Add support for mocking final classes/methods using ByteBuddy
issue.body: Mockito 2 has experimental support for mocking final classes/methods (https://github.com/mockito/mockito/wiki/What%27s-new-in-Mockito-2#unmockable). Since Spock as of 1.1 also supports ByteBuddy, it should be possible to also support mocking of final classes/methods.

comment.body:
2.4 actually.
2.3 is already released.
The milestone just was not closed and new created.
